account.title: Octopus Energy Account
account.description: Setup your basic account information. Full documentation can be found at https://bottlecapdave.github.io/HomeAssistant-OctopusEnergy/setup/account

data.favour_direct_debit_rates: Favour direct debit rates where available
data.auto_discover_cost_trackers: Automatically discover sensors suitable for cost trackers

data_description.account_id: You account ID can be found on your bill or at the top of https://octopus.energy/dashboard
data_description.api_key: You API key can be found at https://octopus.energy/dashboard/new/accounts/personal-details/api-access
data_description.calorific_value: This can be found on your gas statement and can change from time to time

home_mini_settings.name: Home Mini settings
home_mini_settings.description: Settings related to the Home Mini - https://octopus.energy/blog/octopus-home-mini/

data.live_electricity_consumption_refresh_in_: Home Mini electricity refresh rate in minutes
data.live_gas_consumption_refresh_in_minutes: Home Mini gas refresh rate in minutes

data_description.home_pro_api_key: This is only required if you have setup the custom API.
This is only required if you have setup the custom API.

price_cap_settings.name: Price cap settings
price_cap_settings.description: This is related to manual price caps. This usually comes from the OE APIs and doesn't need to be set.

data.electricity_price_cap: Optional electricity price cap in pence
data.gas_price_cap: Optional gas price cap in pence

intelligent_settings.name: Intelligent settings
intelligent_settings.description: These are settings related to the intelligent tariff. If you're not on this tariff, none of this applies.

data_description.intelligent_manual_dispatches: This will expose a service which can be called to refresh the dispatches on demand. See docs for more information.
data_description.intelligent_rate_mode: Determines how rates should be adjusted when dispatches are found outside of normal off peak periods

target_rate.title: Octopus Energy Target Rate
target_rate.description: Setup a target rate period. Continuous target will find the cheapest continuous period for your target hours. While intermittent will find the cheapest periods with potential gaps, which when combined will meet your target hours. Full documentation can be found at https://bottlecapdave.github.io/HomeAssistant-OctopusEnergy/setup/target_rate

data.name: The name of your target
data.hours: The hours you require in decimal format.
data.hours_mode: How the defined hours should be interpreted
data.type: The type of target you're after
data.mpan: The MPAN number of the meter to apply the target to
data.start_time: The minimum time to start the device
data.end_time: The maximum time to stop the device
data.offset: The offset to apply to the scheduled block to be considered active
data.minimum_rate: The optional minimum rate for target hours
data.maximum_rate: The optional maximum rate for target hours
data.weighting: The optional weighting to apply to the discovered rates
data.free_electricity_weighting: The weighting to apply to rates during free electricity sessions
data.target_times_evaluation_mode: When should target times be selected

data_description.hours: This has to be a multiple of 0.5.
data_description.minimum_rate: This is in pounds and pence (e.g. 0.12)
data_description.maximum_rate: This is in pounds and pence (e.g. 0.12)

target_rate_account.title: Octopus Energy Target Rate
target_rate_account.description: Select the account your target rate sensor will be using for its calculations

rolling_target_rate_account.title: Octopus Energy Rolling Target Rate
rolling_target_rate_account.description: Select the account your rolling target rate sensor will be using for its calculations

rolling_target_rate.title: Octopus Energy Rolling Target Rate
rolling_target_rate.description: Setup a rolling target rate period. Continuous target will find the cheapest continuous period for your target hours. While intermittent will find the cheapest periods with potential gaps, which when combined will meet your target hours. Full documentation can be found at https://bottlecapdave.github.io/HomeAssistant-OctopusEnergy/setup/rolling_target_rate

data.name: The name of your target
data.hours: The hours you require in decimal format.
data.hours_mode: How the defined hours should be interpreted
data.mpan: The MPAN number of the meter to apply the target to
data.look_ahead_hours: The number of hours to look ahead when evaluating the available rates
data.offset: The offset to apply to the scheduled block to be considered active
data.minimum_rate: The optional minimum rate for target hours
data.maximum_rate: The optional maximum rate for target hours
data.weighting: The optional weighting to apply to the discovered rates
data.free_electricity_weighting: The weighting to apply to rates during free electricity sessions
data.target_times_evaluation_mode: When should target times be selected

cost_tracker.title: Octopus Energy Cost Tracker
cost_tracker.description: Track the cost for a given energy based sensor. Full documentation can be found at https://bottlecapdave.github.io/HomeAssistant-OctopusEnergy/setup/cost_tracker.

data.name: The name of your cost sensor
data.mpan: The meter the cost rates should be associated with
data.target_entity_id: The entity to track the costs for.
data.weekday_reset: The day when the week cost sensor should reset
data.month_day_reset: The day when the month cost sensor should reset
data.manual_reset: Don't automatically reset the cost sensor

data_description.manual_reset: If enabled, you will need to manually reset this sensor via the available service. You will also not get week and month sensors. This may produce Home Assistant warnings if not reset for long periods of times.

cost_tracker_account.title: Octopus Energy Cost Tracker
cost_tracker_account.description: Select the account your cost tracker will be using for its calculations

tariff_comparison.title: Octopus Energy Tariff Comparison
tariff_comparison.description: Compare your cost with another tariff to see if you're on the best tariff for your energy use. Full documentation can be found at https://bottlecapdave.github.io/HomeAssistant-OctopusEnergy/setup/tariff_comparison.

data.name: The name of your tariff comparison
data.mpan_mprn: The meter of the data that should be compared to
data.product_code: The product code of the tariff to compare.
data.tariff_code: The tariff code of the tariff to compare.

tariff_comparison_account.title: Octopus Energy Tariff Comparison
tariff_comparison_account.description: Select the account your tariff comparison will be using for its calculations

reconfigure_account.title: Update Account Info
reconfigure_account.description: Update your basic account information. Full documentation can be found at https://bottlecapdave.github.io/HomeAssistant-OctopusEnergy/setup/account

data.favour_direct_debit_rates: Favour direct debit rates where available

reconfigure_target_rate.title: Update Target Rate
reconfigure_target_rate.description: Update the settings for your target rate sensor, which can be used to help you save energy and money. Full documentation can be found at https://bottlecapdave.github.io/HomeAssistant-OctopusEnergy/setup/target_rate

data.hours: The hours you require in decimal format.
data.hours_mode: How the defined hours should be interpreted
data.mpan: The MPAN number of the meter to apply the target to
data.start_time: The minimum time to start the device
data.end_time: The maximum time to stop the device
data.offset: The offset to apply to the scheduled block to be considered active
data.minimum_rate: The optional minimum rate for target hours
data.maximum_rate: The optional maximum rate for target hours
data.weighting: The optional weighting to apply to the discovered rates
data.free_electricity_weighting: The weighting to apply to rates during free electricity sessions
data.target_times_evaluation_mode: When should target times be selected

reconfigure_rolling_target_rate.description: Update the settings for your rolling target rate sensor, which can be used to help you save energy and money. Full documentation can be found at https://bottlecapdave.github.io/HomeAssistant-OctopusEnergy/setup/rolling_target_rate

data.hours: The hours you require in decimal format.
data.hours_mode: How the defined hours should be interpreted
data.mpan: The MPAN number of the meter to apply the target to
data.look_ahead_hours: The number of hours to look ahead when evaluating the available rates
data.offset: The offset to apply to the scheduled block to be considered active

data.maximum_rate: The optional maximum rate for target hours
data.weighting: The optional weighting to apply to the discovered rates
data.free_electricity_weighting: The weighting to apply to rates during free electricity sessions
data.target_times_evaluation_mode: When should target times be selected

data_description.hours: This has to be a multiple of 0.5.
data_description.minimum_rate: This is in pounds and pence (e.g. 0.12)
data_description.maximum_rate: This is in pounds and pence (e.g. 0.12)

data.name: The name of your cost sensor
data.mpan: The meter the cost rates should be associated with
data.target_entity_id: The entity to track the costs for.
data.weekday_reset: The day when the week cost sensor should reset
data.month_day_reset: The day when the month cost sensor should reset
data.manual_reset: Don't automatically reset the cost sensor

data_description.manual_reset: If enabled, you will need to manually reset this sensor via the available service. You will also not get week and month sensors. This may produce Home Assistant warnings if not reset for long periods of times.

reconfigure_tariff_comparison.description: Compare your cost with another tariff to see if you're on the best tariff for your energy use. Full documentation can be found at https://bottlecapdave.github.io/HomeAssistant-OctopusEnergy/setup/tariff_comparison.

error.server_error: Failed to connect to OE servers. Please try again later
error.account_not_found: Invalid API key or account id specified
error.value_greater_than_zero: Value must be greater or equal to 1
error.invalid_target_hours: Target hours must be in half hour increments (e.g. 0.5 = 30 minutes; 1 = 60 minutes).
error.invalid_target_name: Name must only include lower case alpha characters and underscore (e.g. my_target)
error.invalid_target_time: Must be in the format HH:MM
error.invalid_offset: Offset must be in the form of HH:MM:SS with an optional negative symbol
error.invalid_hours_time_frame: The target hours do not fit in the elected target time frame
error.invalid_mpan: Meter not found in account with an active tariff
error.invalid_end_time_agile: Target time not fit for agile tariffs. Please consult target rate documentation for more information.
error.invalid_week_day: Week reset day must be between 0 and 6 (inclusively)
error.invalid_month_day: Month reset day must be between 1 and 28 (inclusively)
error.invalid_price: Price must be in the form pounds and pence (e.g. 0.10)
error.invalid_weighting: The weighting format is not supported. Please consult documentation for more information.
error.invalid_weighting_slots: The number of weighting blocks does not equal the specified number of hours.
error.weighting_not_supported_for_type: Weighting is only supported for continuous target rates
error.weighting_not_supported_for_hour_mode: Weighting is not supported for this hour mode
error.invalid_product_or_tariff: Product or tariff code does not exist
error.minimum_or_maximum_rate_not_specified: Either minimum and/or maximum rate must be specified for minimum hours mode
error.all_home_pro_values_not_set: Home Pro address must be set if API key is set
error.home_pro_connection_failed: Cannot connect to Home Pro device. Please check the specified address is correct and that you've installed the custom API as per the instructions.
error.home_pro_authentication_failed: Cannot authenticate with API on Home Pro device. Please check authentication token matches the value you configured.
error.home_pro_not_responding: Connected to Home Pro device, but responding with unsuccessful status. This implies the Home Pro failed to connect to your meter.

abort.not_supported: Configuration for target rates is not supported at the moment.

octoplus_points_no_points.message: The minimum number of redeemable points is not available

octoplus_points_maximum_points.message: You cannot redeem more than {redeemable_points} points

invalid_target_temperature.message: Temperature must be equal or between {min_temperature} and {max_temperature}

point_in_time_intelligent_dispatch_histo.message: The requested point in time is before historic data is available. The earliest available intelligent dispatch data is from {earliest_timestamp}
No intelligent dispatch data is currently available. This will refresh automatically over time when intelligent dispatches are updated.

account_not_found.title: Account "{account_id}" not found
account_not_found.description: The integration failed to retrieve the information associated with your configured account. Please check your account exists and that your API key is valid. Click "Learn More" to find out how to fix this.

unknown_tariff_format.title: Invalid format - {type} - {tariff_code}
unknown_tariff_format.description: The tariff "{tariff_code}" associated with your {type} meter is not in an expected format. Click on "Learn More" with instructions on what to do next.

unknown_product.title: Unknown product - {type} - {product_code}
unknown_product.description: The product "{product_code}" associated with your {type} meter has not been found. Click on "Learn More" with instructions on what to do next.

invalid_target_rate.title: Invalid target rate "{name}"
invalid_target_rate.description: The target rate "{name}" has become invalid. Click on "Learn More" with instructions on what to do next.

octopus_mini_not_valid.title: Octopus Mini not valid for {type} meter
octopus_mini_not_valid.description: Octopus Mini has been configured for account "{account_id}", but it's not available for {type} meter {mpan_mprn}/{serial_number}. If this is expected, you can ignore this notice, otherwise click "Learn More" with instructions on what to do next.

invalid_api_key.title: Invalid API key for account "{account_id}"
invalid_api_key.description: The configured API key appears to be invalid for the configured account "{account_id}". Please reconfigure to fix this issue.

electricity_unique_rates_updated.title: "{account_id}" requires reloading
electricity_unique_rates_updated.description: The electricity rates for "{account_id}" have updated which result in either entities no longer updating correctly or new entities becoming available. Please reload the integration associated with this account to fix this issue.

cost_override_obsolete.title: Cost override has been deprecated
cost_override_obsolete.description: It looks like you've setup the cost override entities for {type} meter {mpan_mprn}/{serial_number}. These cost override entities have been deprecated in favour of setting them up via the integrations page. Please click "Learn More" with instructions on what to do next.

unknown_intelligent_provider.title: Unknown intelligent provider "{provider}"
unknown_intelligent_provider.description: You have an intelligent provider of "{provider}" which is not recognised and therefore a reduced feature set has been enabled. Click on "Learn More" with instructions on what to do next.

intelligent_manual_service.title: Manual intelligent dispatch refresh service available for {account_id}
intelligent_manual_service.description:
By default, dispatches are retrieved every {polling_time} minutes. If you know when your car has started charging via other means, you might want to activate manual polling mode which will expose a service for retrieving dispatches on-demand. This is the recommended way to get the information as soon as possible and reduce unnecessary calls to the Octopus Energy servers. If you can't do this, then just ignore this repair notice and continue with the automatic polling.

If you wish to enable this service, then click "Learn More" to find out more about the setting and associated service. Once enabled, this repair notice will be removed.

no_active_tariff.title: No active tariff - {meter_type} ({mpan_mprn}/{serial_number})
no_active_tariff.description: You do not have an active tariff associated with your {meter_type} meter ({mpan_mprn}/{serial_number}). Please click "Learn More" with instructions on how this can be resolved.

target_rate_removal_proposal.title: Proposal: The removal of target rate sensors from the integration
target_rate_removal_proposal.description: It looks like you're using target rate sensors. There is currently a proposal to remove this functionality due to it existing in a separate integration. Please click "Learn More" to see the full reasoning and provide your feedback. Click ignore to not see this proposal again.

intelligent_device_not_found.title: Intelligent device not found for {account_id}
intelligent_device_not_found.description: Your intelligent device cannot be found for your account. Please check your intelligent device is setup in your account via the Octopus Energy app.

intelligent_device_added.title: Intelligent device discovered for {account_id}
intelligent_device_added.description: Your intelligent device has been discovered. You will need to reload the integration in order to see the new device. This cannot be done automatically.

intelligent_device_removed.title: Intelligent device removed for {account_id}
intelligent_device_removed.description: An intelligent device has been removed from your account. All sensors associated with the device will stop working. Once reloaded, you can delete your old intelligent device within Home Assistant. This cannot be done automatically.

meter_removed.title: {meter_type} meter removed for {account_id} ({mprn_mpan}/{serial_number})
meter_removed.description: A meter that was previously configured for your account has either been removed or not longer has an active tariff. Please check your account to see if this was expected. If it was, the associated entities will no longer be provided when you next reload the integration and you can delete them. If it wasn't, please click "Learn More" with details on how to rectify this.

meter_added.title: {meter_type} meter added for {account_id} ({mprn_mpan}/{serial_number})
meter_added.description: A new meter has been found for your account which has an active tariff. Please reload the integration to start using this meter and associated entities.

tariff_rates_empty.title: {meter_type} {tariff_code} rates are empty for {account_id} ({mprn_mpan}/{serial_number})
tariff_rates_empty.description: One of your meters ({mprn_mpan}/{serial_number}) is associated with tariff "{tariff_code}" for product "{product_code}", but no longer seems to be returning new rates. Please click "Learn More" with details on how to rectify this.

saving_session_binary_sensor_deprecated.title: Saving session binary sensor deprecated
saving_session_binary_sensor_deprecated.description: The saving session binary sensor (`binary_sensor.octopus_energy_ACCOUNT_ID_octoplus_saving_sessions`) has been deprecated in favour of using calendar entities. This will allow for better integration with automations and the calendar view. The deprecated sensor will be removed in May 2026. Please click "Learn More" for more information on this change.

free_electricity_session_binary_sensor_d.title: Free electricity session binary sensor deprecated
free_electricity_session_binary_sensor_d.description: The free electricity session binary sensor (`binary_sensor.octopus_energy_ACCOUNT_ID_octoplus_free_electricity_session`) has been deprecated in favour of using calendar entities. This will allow for better integration with automations and the calendar view. The deprecated sensor will be removed in May 2026. Please click "Learn More" for more information on this change.

greenness_forecast_binary_sensor_depreca.title: Greenness forecast highlighted binary sensor deprecated
greenness_forecast_binary_sensor_depreca.description: The greenness forecast highlighted binary sensor (`binary_sensor.octopus_energy_ACCOUNT_ID_greenness_forecast_highlighted`) has been deprecated in favour of using calendar entities. This will allow for better integration with automations and the calendar view. The deprecated sensor will be removed in May 2026. If you are using this sensor, please migrate all uses before the update around that time.

state.octopus_energy_elec_previous_consumption: Electricity previous consumption tariff comparison rates

state.octopus_energy_gas_previous_consumption_: Gas previous consumption tariff comparison rates
